intro: Wikstroemia genkwa, commonly known as Chinese sandarac, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces a resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. It typically grows in forested areas and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a branching structure that supports its flowering habit.
